Implement the following plan:

# Plan: Add Pylint, Tighten CPD, Parallelize CI

## Context

The project has ruff, black, radon, CPD (symilar at -d 15), and tests. The user wants to:
1. Add full pylint checking — fix all real issues so pylint passes clean
2. Lower CPD threshold from 15 to 5 lines and fix resulting duplicates
3. Split `make check` into parallel GitHub Actions jobs to reduce CI time

## Part A — Pylint

### A1. Configure pylint in `pyproject.toml`

Add `[tool.pylint]` config. Disable checks that are false positives or handled by other tools:

```toml
[tool.pylint.main]
load-plugins = []

[tool.pylint."messages control"]
disable = [
    "E0401",   # import-error — false positive under uvx (no venv)
    "W0718",   # broad-exception-caught — suppressed globally per user decision
    "R0801",   # duplicate-code — handled by `make cpd`
    "C0301",   # line-too-long — handled by ruff/black
    "C0302",   # too-many-lines — handled by ruff
    "C0114",   # missing-module-docstring — not enforced in this project
    "C0115",   # missing-class-docstring — not enforced in this project
    "R0903",   # too-few-public-methods — dataclass/protocol pattern
    "R0902",   # too-many-instance-attributes — config objects
    "R0913",   # too-many-arguments — structural
    "R0917",   # too-many-positional-arguments — structural
    "R0904",   # too-many-public-methods — provider pattern
    "R0911",   # too-many-return-statements — structural
    "R0914",   # too-many-locals — structural
    "C0103",   # invalid-name — naming conventions differ from pylint defaults
    "W0603",   # global-statement — used sparingly, intentional
    "W0621",   # redefined-outer-name — rare, intentional
]
```

### A2. Fix trivial pylint issues (~60 changes)

| Code | Symbol | Count | Fix |
|------|--------|-------|-----|
| W2301 | unnecessary-ellipsis | 28 | Remove `...` from ABC methods that have docstrings |
| W0107 | unnecessary-pass | 5 | Remove `pass` from methods that have docstrings |
| W0108 | unnecessary-lambda | 4 | Replace `lambda v: v` with identity or direct ref |
| C0325 | superfluous-parens | 1 | Remove extra parens in `config/loader.py:56` |
| W0707 | raise-missing-from | 5 | Add `from exc` to re-raises |
| W0706 | try-except-raise | 1 | Remove bare re-raise in `dynamodb/streams.py:259` |
| W0404 | reimported | 4 | Move imports to top-level or remove duplicate |
| W0612 | unused-variable | 5 | Prefix with `_` |
| W0622 | redefined-builtin | 1 | Rename `input` in `stepfunctions.py:24` |
| R1714 | consider-using-in | 1 | Use `x in (a, b)` in `ecs/alb.py:62` |
| R1732 | consider-using-with | 1 | Use `with` in `docker.py:397` |

**Files affected:** ~20 files across `src/lws/`

### A3. Fix missing docstrings (C0116 — 30 issues)

Add one-line docstrings to functions in:
- `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/routes.py` (10)
- `src/lws/providers/apigateway/routes.py` (8)
- `src/lws/parser/assembly.py` (4)
- `src/lws/graph/builder.py` (3)
- `src/lws/runtime/watcher.py` (3)
- `src/lws/runtime/orchestrator.py` (1)
- `src/lws/providers/stepfunctions/engine.py` (1)

### A4. Fix unused arguments (W0613 — 63 issues)

Prefix unused function arguments with `_` (e.g. `body` → `_body`, `request` → `_request`). Files affected:
- `src/lws/providers/apigateway/routes.py` (~15)
- `src/lws/providers/sns/routes.py` (6) and `topic.py` (3)
- `src/lws/providers/stepfunctions/routes.py` (6) and `engine.py` (1) and `provider.py` (1)
- `src/lws/providers/dynamodb/routes.py` (4) and `expressions.py` (2) and `update_expression.py` (2)
- `src/lws/providers/iam/routes.py` (4)
- `src/lws/providers/sqs/routes.py` (2)
- `src/lws/providers/secretsmanager/routes.py` (1)
- `src/lws/providers/eventbridge/routes.py` (1)
- `src/lws/providers/cognito/routes.py` (3)
- `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/routes.py` (2)
- `src/lws/providers/ecs/alb.py` (1)
- `src/lws/providers/sts/routes.py` (1)
- `src/lws/cli/ldk.py` (1) and `services/apigateway.py` (1)
- `src/lws/validation/integration.py` (1)
- `src/lws/providers/dynamodb/streams.py` (1)

### A5. Fix protected-access (W0212 — 82 issues)

Add `@property` accessors to provider/state classes, then update routes to use public names.

**State classes to modify (add `@property` methods):**

| File | Class | Private → Property |
|------|-------|-------------------|
| `src/lws/providers/ssm/routes.py` | `_SsmState` | `_parameters` → `parameters` |
| `src/lws/providers/secretsmanager/routes.py` | `_SecretsState` | `_secrets` → `secrets` |
| `src/lws/providers/iam/routes.py` | `_IamState` | `_roles`, `_role_policies`, `_attached_policies`, `_policies`, `_instance_profiles` → public properties |
| `src/lws/providers/sqs/provider.py` | `SqsProvider` | `_queues`, `_configs` → public properties |
| `src/lws/providers/sqs/queue.py` | `LocalQueue` | `_messages` → `messages` |
| `src/lws/providers/s3/provider.py` | `S3Provider` | `_dispatcher` → `dispatcher` |
| `src/lws/providers/sns/provider.py` | `LocalTopic` / subscription | `_custom_attrs` → `custom_attrs` |
| `src/lws/providers/dynamodb/provider.py` | `DynamoDbProvider` | `_running` → `running` |
| `src/lws/runtime/orchestrator.py` | `Orchestrator` | `_providers` → `providers` |

Then update all route files + `src/lws/api/management.py` + `src/lws/cli/ldk.py` to use the public properties.

### A6. Fix import-outside-toplevel (C0415 — 46 issues)

Add inline `# pylint: disable=import-outside-toplevel` to intentional lazy imports. These are in:
- `src/lws/cli/ldk.py` (21 — CLI startup performance)
- `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/docker.py` (1 — conditional `docker` import)
- `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/python_bootstrap.py` (1 — conditional `debugpy`)
- `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/routes.py` (3)
- `src/lws/providers/sns/provider.py` (2)
- `src/lws/providers/ecs/provider.py`, `health_check.py` (2)
- `src/lws/providers/sqs/routes.py` (3)
- `src/lws/providers/stepfunctions/provider.py` (2)
- `src/lws/providers/apigateway/routes.py` (1)
- `src/lws/cli/lws.py` (2)
- `src/lws/parser/assembly.py` (1)
- `src/lws/logging/logger.py`, `middleware.py` (2)

For the 4 reimported cases (W0404 in `sns/provider.py`, `sqs/routes.py`), move the import to the top of the file instead, which also fixes C0415 for those.

### A7. Add `pylint` Makefile target

```makefile
pylint: ## Run pylint checks
	uvx --from pylint pylint src/lws --recursive=y
```

Update `check` and `.PHONY`.

## Part B — CPD Threshold 5

### B1. Lower CPD threshold from 15 → 5

Update Makefile `cpd` target: change `-d 15` to `-d 5`.

### B2. Fix new duplicate pairs (14 pairs, 146 lines)

**Pair 1: docker.py result parsing (18 lines)**
- `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/docker.py` — make `_parse_result()` call existing `result_parser.parse_invocation_output()`

**Pairs 2, 5, 9, 10: DynamoDB tokenizer/parser (46 lines across 4 pairs)**
- Create `src/lws/providers/dynamodb/parser_base.py` with shared `Token` dataclass and `BaseParser` class (`__init__`, `_peek`, `_advance`, `_expect`)
- Update `expressions.py` and `update_expression.py` to import `Token` from `parser_base` and have `_Parser` extend `BaseParser`
- Keep `tokenize()` functions separate (different grammars)

**Pairs 3, 4, 8: Lambda nodejs/python compute (44 lines across 3 pairs)**
- Create `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/compute_base.py` with a `BaseCompute` class extracting: `stop()`, `health_check()`, the common `invoke()` timeout/dispatch pattern, and `_run_subprocess_and_parse()`
- `NodeJsCompute` and `PythonCompute` extend `BaseCompute`, override `_build_env()` and `_run_subprocess()`

**Pairs 6, 7, 11, 12: `_parse_request_body` / `_resolve_action` (33 lines across 4 pairs)**
- Create `src/lws/providers/_shared/request_helpers.py` with `parse_json_body()` and `resolve_api_action()`
- Update 5 files: `secretsmanager/routes.py`, `ssm/routes.py`, `stepfunctions/routes.py`, `lambda_runtime/routes.py`, `apigateway/routes.py`

**Pair 13: SQS QueueConfig construction (7 lines)**
- Extract `build_queue_config(queue_name, attrs)` factory function in `sqs/provider.py`
- Update `sqs/routes.py` to import and use it

**Pair 14: LambdaContext construction (6 lines)**
- Extract `build_default_lambda_context(function_name)` into `src/lws/providers/_shared/lambda_helpers.py`
- Update `apigateway/routes.py` and `lambda_runtime/routes.py` to use it

## Part C — Parallel CI

### C1. Update `.github/workflows/ci.yml`

Split single `check` job into parallel jobs sharing a setup step:

```yaml
jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make lint
      - run: make format-check

  analysis:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make complexity
      - run: make cpd
      - run: make pylint

  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test
```

This groups fast checks (lint + format: ~5s) and analysis (complexity + cpd + pylint: ~15s) separately from the slow test suite (~35s). All 3 jobs run in parallel.

### C2. Update `.github/workflows/publish.yml`

Replace `make check` with the same three parallel jobs, then have `build` depend on all three.

### C3. Update `Makefile`

```makefile
check: lint format-check complexity cpd pylint test
```

### C4. Update `contributing/LINTING.md`

- Renumber sections: 1. Lint, 2. Format, 3. Complexity, 4. CPD (updated threshold to 5), 5. Pylint (new), 6. Tests
- Add pylint section documenting: tool, config location, disabled checks, how to fix violations
- Update CPD section threshold from 15 to 5
- Update quick reference table with `make pylint`

## Files Modified Summary

| File | Action |
|------|--------|
| **Config** | |
| `pyproject.toml` | Add `[tool.pylint]` config |
| `Makefile` | Add `pylint` target, update `cpd` threshold, update `check` |
| `.github/workflows/ci.yml` | Split into 3 parallel jobs |
| `.github/workflows/publish.yml` | Split into 3 parallel jobs + build |
| `contributing/LINTING.md` | Add pylint section, update CPD threshold, renumber |
| **CPD dedup — new modules** | |
| `src/lws/providers/dynamodb/parser_base.py` | Create — shared Token + BaseParser |
| `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/compute_base.py` | Create — shared compute base class |
| `src/lws/providers/_shared/request_helpers.py` | Create — shared request body parsing |
| `src/lws/providers/_shared/lambda_helpers.py` | Create — shared LambdaContext builder |
| **CPD dedup — updates** | |
| `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/docker.py` | Use result_parser |
| `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/nodejs.py` | Extend compute_base |
| `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/python.py` | Extend compute_base |
| `src/lws/providers/dynamodb/expressions.py` | Import Token + extend BaseParser |
| `src/lws/providers/dynamodb/update_expression.py` | Import Token + extend BaseParser |
| `src/lws/providers/secretsmanager/routes.py` | Use shared request_helpers |
| `src/lws/providers/ssm/routes.py` | Use shared request_helpers |
| `src/lws/providers/stepfunctions/routes.py` | Use shared request_helpers |
| `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/routes.py` | Use shared request_helpers + lambda_helpers |
| `src/lws/providers/apigateway/routes.py` | Use shared request_helpers + lambda_helpers |
| `src/lws/providers/sqs/provider.py` | Extract build_queue_config factory |
| `src/lws/providers/sqs/routes.py` | Use build_queue_config |
| **Pylint fixes — ~40 files across src/lws/** | |
| ~20 files | Trivial fixes (ellipsis, pass, lambda, parens, etc.) |
| ~7 files | Add missing docstrings |
| ~15 files | Prefix unused args with `_` |
| ~10 provider/state classes | Add `@property` accessors |
| ~10 route files | Use public properties instead of `_private` |
| ~15 files | Add `# pylint: disable=import-outside-toplevel` |

## Part D — `assert_invoke` returns parsed JSON

### D1. Update `tests/e2e/conftest.py`

Both `lws_invoke` and `assert_invoke` currently return `result.output` (a raw string). The CLI outputs JSON, so every test calls `json.loads()` on the result — 73 calls across 61 e2e test files.

Change both fixtures to auto-parse: `return json.loads(result.output)` (returning `dict | list`). Add a fallback: if JSON parsing fails, return the raw string (for the rare non-JSON commands).

### D2. Remove `json.loads` from all e2e tests

Remove the `json.loads(...)` wrapping from all 73 call sites across 61 files in `tests/e2e/`. Also remove `import json` from files where it's no longer needed.

## Verification

```bash
make lint           # ruff passes
make format-check   # black passes
make complexity     # radon passes
make cpd            # 0 duplicates at threshold 5
make pylint         # pylint passes clean
make test           # 1729+ tests pass
make check          # full pipeline passes
```


If you need specific details from before exiting plan mode (like exact code snippets, error messages, or content you generated), read the full transcript at: /Users/eamonnfaherty/.REDACTED.jsonl

        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make lint
      - run: make format-check

  analysis:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make complexity
      - run: make cpd
      - run: make pylint

  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test
```

This groups fast checks (lint + format: ~5s) and analysis (complexity + cpd + pylint: ~15s) separately from the slow test suite (~35s). All 3 jobs run in parallel.

### C2. Update `.github/workflows/publish.yml`

Replace `make check` with the same three parallel jobs, then have `build` depend on all three.

### C3. Update `Makefile`

```makefile
check: lint format-check complexity cpd pylint test
```

### C4. Update `contributing/LINTING.md`

- Renumber sections: 1. Lint, 2. Format, 3. Complexity, 4. CPD (updated threshold to 5), 5. Pylint (new), 6. Tests
- Add pylint section documenting: tool, config location, disabled checks, how to fix violations
- Update CPD section threshold from 15 to 5
- Update quick reference table with `make pylint`

## Files Modified Summary

| File | Action |
|------|--------|
| **Config** | |
| `pyproject.toml` | Add `[tool.pylint]` config |
| `Makefile` | Add `pylint` target, update `cpd` threshold, update `check` |
| `.github/workflows/ci.yml` | Split into 3 parallel jobs |
| `.github/workflows/publish.yml` | Split into 3 parallel jobs + build |
| `contributing/LINTING.md` | Add pylint section, update CPD threshold, renumber |
| **CPD dedup — new modules** | |
| `src/lws/providers/dynamodb/parser_base.py` | Create — shared Token + BaseParser |
| `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/compute_base.py` | Create — shared compute base class |
| `src/lws/providers/_shared/request_helpers.py` | Create — shared request body parsing |
| `src/lws/providers/_shared/lambda_helpers.py` | Create — shared LambdaContext builder |
| **CPD dedup — updates** | |
| `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/docker.py` | Use result_parser |
| `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/nodejs.py` | Extend compute_base |
| `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/python.py` | Extend compute_base |
| `src/lws/providers/dynamodb/expressions.py` | Import Token + extend BaseParser |
| `src/lws/providers/dynamodb/update_expression.py` | Import Token + extend BaseParser |
| `src/lws/providers/secretsmanager/routes.py` | Use shared request_helpers |
| `src/lws/providers/ssm/routes.py` | Use shared request_helpers |
| `src/lws/providers/stepfunctions/routes.py` | Use shared request_helpers |
| `src/lws/providers/lambda_runtime/routes.py` | Use shared request_helpers + lambda_helpers |
| `src/lws/providers/apigateway/routes.py` | Use shared request_helpers + lambda_helpers |
| `src/lws/providers/sqs/provider.py` | Extract build_queue_config factory |
| `src/lws/providers/sqs/routes.py` | Use build_queue_config |
| **Pylint fixes — ~40 files across src/lws/** | |
| ~20 files | Trivial fixes (ellipsis, pass, lambda, parens, etc.) |
| ~7 files | Add missing docstrings |
| ~15 files | Prefix unused args with `_` |
| ~10 provider/state classes | Add `@property` accessors |
| ~10 route files | Use public properties instead of `_private` |
| ~15 files | Add `# pylint: disable=import-outside-toplevel` |

## Part D — `assert_invoke` returns parsed JSON

### D1. Update `tests/e2e/conftest.py`

Both `lws_invoke` and `assert_invoke` currently return `result.output` (a raw string). The CLI outputs JSON, so every test calls `json.loads()` on the result — 73 calls across 61 e2e test files.

Change both fixtures to auto-parse: `return json.loads(result.output)` (returning `dict | list`). Add a fallback: if JSON parsing fails, return the raw string (for the rare non-JSON commands).

### D2. Remove `json.loads` from all e2e tests

Remove the `json.loads(...)` wrapping from all 73 call sites across 61 files in `tests/e2e/`. Also remove `import json` from files where it's no longer needed.

## Verification

```bash
make lint           # ruff passes
make format-check   # black passes
make complexity     # radon passes
make cpd            # 0 duplicates at threshold 5
make pylint         # pylint passes clean
make test           # 1729+ tests pass
make check          # full pipeline passes
```

.DEFAULT_GOAL := help

.PHONY: help install lint format format-check complexity cpd test test-e2e check

help: ## Show available targets
	@grep -E '^[a-zA-Z_-]+:.*?## .*$$' $(MAKEFILE_LIST) | awk 'BEGIN {FS = ":.*?## "}; {printf "  %-15s %s\n", $$1, $$2}'

install: ## Install dependencies
	uv sync

lint: ## Run linter
	uvx ruff check src tests

format: ## Auto-format code
	uvx black src tests

format-check: ## Check formatting without changing files
	uvx black --check src tests

complexity: ## Check cyclomatic complexity (all functions must be grade B or better)
	uvx radon cc src -a -nc

cpd: ## Check for copy-pasted code (15+ similar lines)
	@output=$$(uvx --from pylint symilar -d 15 --ignore-imports --ignore-docstrings --ignore-signatures $$(find src -name "*.py")); \
	echo "$$output" | tail -1; \
	echo "$$output" | tail -1 | grep -q "duplicates=0 " || { echo "$$output"; exit 1; }

test: ## Run test suite (excludes e2e)
	uv run pytest --ignore=tests/e2e

test-e2e: ## Run e2e tests (no Docker required)
	uv run pytest tests/e2e/ -v

check: lint format-check complexity cpd test ## Run all checks (what CI runs)

[project]
name = "local-web-services"
version = "0.5.0"
description = "Run AWS CDK applications locally - accelerate development with agentic code editors"
readme = "README.md"
license = "MIT"
requires-python = ">=3.11"
keywords = ["aws", "cdk", "local", "development", "lambda", "dynamodb", "sqs", "sns", "s3", "ssm", "secretsmanager", "agentic", "ai", "code-editor", "vibe-coding"]
classifiers = [
    "Development Status :: 4 - Beta",
    "Intended Audience :: Developers",
    "License :: OSI Approved :: MIT License",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.11",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.12",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.13",
    "Topic :: Software Development :: Testing",
    "Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries",
]
dependencies = [
    "fastapi>=0.110.0",
    "uvicorn[standard]>=0.27.0",
    "typer>=0.9.0",
    "watchdog>=4.0.0",
    "aiosqlite>=0.20.0",
    "croniter>=2.0.0",
    "rich>=13.0.0",
    "python-multipart>=0.0.9",
    "pyjwt[crypto]>=2.8.0",
    "httpx>=0.27.0",
    "docker>=7.0.0",
]

[project.urls]
Homepage = "https://local-web-services.github.io/www"
Repository = "https://github.com/local-web-services/local-web-services"
Issues = "https://github.com/local-web-services/local-web-services/issues"

[project.scripts]
ldk = "lws.cli.ldk:app"
lws = "lws.cli.lws:app"

[build-system]
requires = ["hatchling"]
build-backend = "hatchling.build"

[tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]
packages = ["src/lws"]

[tool.pytest.ini_options]
testpaths = ["tests"]
asyncio_mode = "auto"

[dependency-groups]
dev = [
    "httpx>=0.28.1",
    "pytest>=9.0.2",
    "pytest-asyncio>=1.3.0",
    "black>=24.0.0",
    "ruff>=0.4.0",
    "radon>=6.0.0",
]

[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
    "pytest>=8.0.0",
    "pytest-asyncio>=0.23.0",
    "httpx>=0.27.0",
    "black>=24.0.0",
    "ruff>=0.4.0",
    "radon>=6.0.0",
]

[tool.black]
line-length = 100
target-version = ["py311"]

[tool.ruff]
line-length = 100
target-version = "py311"

[tool.ruff.lint]
select = ["E", "F", "I", "W", "UP", "C90"]

[tool.ruff.lint.isort]
known-first-party = ["lws"]

[tool.ruff.lint.per-file-ignores]
"src/lws/api/gui.py" = ["E501"]

[tool.ruff.lint.mccabe]
max-complexity = 10

name: Publish to PyPI

on:
  release:
    types: [published]

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4

      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"

      - run: make install

      - run: make check

      - run: uv build

      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: dist
          path: dist/

  publish:
    needs: build
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    environment: pypi
    permissions:
      id-token: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: dist
          path: dist/

      - uses: pypa/gh-action-pypi-publish@release/v1

1→# Linting and Formatting Standards
     2→
     3→All code must pass `make check` before merging. This runs five checks in order:
     4→
     5→## 1. Lint (`make lint`)
     6→
     7→```
     8→uvx ruff check src tests
     9→```
    10→
    11→Uses [Ruff](https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/) with these rule sets (configured in `pyproject.toml`):
    12→
    13→| Code | Category | What it catches |
    14→|------|----------|----------------|
    15→| `E` | pycodestyle errors | Syntax issues, line length (max 100), whitespace |
    16→| `F` | pyflakes | Unused imports, undefined names, redefined variables |
    17→| `I` | isort | Import ordering — stdlib, third-party, then first-party (`lws`) |
    18→| `W` | pycodestyle warnings | Trailing whitespace, blank lines |
    19→| `UP` | pyupgrade | Outdated syntax that can use newer Python 3.11+ features |
    20→| `C90` | mccabe | Cyclomatic complexity (max 10 per function) |
    21→
    22→**Auto-fix most issues:**
    23→
    24→```
    25→uvx ruff check --fix src tests
    26→```
    27→
    28→**Key rules:**
    29→
    30→- Line length: 100 characters max (exception: `src/lws/api/gui.py`)
    31→- Imports must be sorted: stdlib, third-party, first-party (`lws`)
    32→- No unused imports or variables
    33→- Target Python version: 3.11
    34→
    35→## 2. Format Check (`make format-check`)
    36→
    37→```
    38→uvx black --check src tests
    39→```
    40→
    41→Uses [Black](https://black.readthedocs.io/) to enforce consistent formatting.
    42→
    43→- Line length: 100 characters
    44→- Target Python version: 3.11
    45→- Deterministic — same input always produces same output
    46→
    47→**Auto-format:**
    48→
    49→```
    50→make format
    51→```
    52→
    53→or equivalently:
    54→
    55→```
    56→uvx black src tests
    57→```
    58→
    59→## 3. Complexity Check (`make complexity`)
    60→
    61→```
    62→uvx radon cc src -a -nc
    63→```
    64→
    65→Uses [Radon](https://radon.readthedocs.io/) to measure cyclomatic complexity. All functions must be **grade B or better** (complexity 10 or less). The `-nc` flag reports only grade C and worse — any output means failure.
    66→
    67→| Grade | Complexity | Status |
    68→|-------|-----------|--------|
    69→| A | 1–5 | Pass |
    70→| B | 6–10 | Pass |
    71→| C | 11–15 | **Fail** |
    72→| D+ | 16+ | **Fail** |
    73→
    74→**To fix:** extract helper functions to reduce branching. Common strategies:
    75→- Replace chained `if/elif` with a dispatch dict or loop
    76→- Extract nested logic into a dedicated helper
    77→- Use data-driven patterns (tuples/lists of descriptors) instead of repeated conditional blocks
    78→
    79→## 4. Copy-Paste Detection (`make cpd`)
    80→
    81→```
    82→uvx --from pylint symilar -d 15 --ignore-imports --ignore-docstrings --ignore-signatures $(find src -name "*.py")
    83→```
    84→
    85→Uses [symilar](https://pylint.readthedocs.io/en/latest/symilar.html) (part of pylint) to detect duplicated code blocks. Any block of 15 or more similar lines in `src/` is flagged.
    86→
    87→- **Scope**: `src/` only — tests are excluded because test files are intentionally repetitive by design
    88→- **Threshold**: 15 minimum duplicate lines (`-d 15`)
    89→- **Ignored**: imports, docstrings, and signatures (these are often legitimately similar)
    90→
    91→**To fix:** extract the shared logic into a common module and import from both call sites. Typical locations for shared code:
    92→
    93→- `src/lws/providers/_shared/` — utilities shared across providers
    94→- A helper module alongside the duplicating files (e.g. `result_parser.py`)
    95→
    96→## 5. Test Suite (`make test`)
    97→
    98→```
    99→uv run pytest --ignore=tests/e2e
   100→```
   101→
   102→Runs all unit, integration, and architecture tests. E2E tests are excluded because they require a running `ldk dev` instance. All tests must pass.
   103→
   104→## Quick Reference
   105→
   106→| Command | Purpose |
   107→|---------|---------|
   108→| `make check` | Run all checks (what CI runs) |
   109→| `make lint` | Lint only |
   110→| `make format` | Auto-format code |
   111→| `make format-check` | Check formatting without changes |
   112→| `make complexity` | Check complexity (grade B or better) |
   113→| `make cpd` | Check for duplicated code (15+ lines) |
   114→| `make test` | Run test suite (excludes e2e) |
   115→| `make test-e2e` | Run e2e tests (requires running `ldk dev`) |
   116→| `uvx ruff check --fix src tests` | Auto-fix lint issues |
   117→
   118→## Before Submitting a PR
   119→
   120→Run `make check` and fix any failures. Most formatting and import issues can be auto-fixed:
   121→
   122→```bash
   123→uvx ruff check --fix src tests  # fix lint issues
   124→make format                      # fix formatting
   125→make check                       # verify everything passes
   126→```
   127→

file.content:
# Linting and Formatting Standards

All code must pass `make check` before merging. This runs five checks in order:

## 1. Lint (`make lint`)

```
uvx ruff check src tests
```

Uses [Ruff](https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/) with these rule sets (configured in `pyproject.toml`):

| Code | Category | What it catches |
|------|----------|----------------|
| `E` | pycodestyle errors | Syntax issues, line length (max 100), whitespace |
| `F` | pyflakes | Unused imports, undefined names, redefined variables |
| `I` | isort | Import ordering — stdlib, third-party, then first-party (`lws`) |
| `W` | pycodestyle warnings | Trailing whitespace, blank lines |
| `UP` | pyupgrade | Outdated syntax that can use newer Python 3.11+ features |
| `C90` | mccabe | Cyclomatic complexity (max 10 per function) |

**Auto-fix most issues:**

```
uvx ruff check --fix src tests
```

**Key rules:**

- Line length: 100 characters max (exception: `src/lws/api/gui.py`)
- Imports must be sorted: stdlib, third-party, first-party (`lws`)
- No unused imports or variables
- Target Python version: 3.11

## 2. Format Check (`make format-check`)

```
uvx black --check src tests
```

Uses [Black](https://black.readthedocs.io/) to enforce consistent formatting.

- Line length: 100 characters
- Target Python version: 3.11
- Deterministic — same input always produces same output

**Auto-format:**

```
make format
```

or equivalently:

```
uvx black src tests
```

## 3. Complexity Check (`make complexity`)

```
uvx radon cc src -a -nc
```

Uses [Radon](https://radon.readthedocs.io/) to measure cyclomatic complexity. All functions must be **grade B or better** (complexity 10 or less). The `-nc` flag reports only grade C and worse — any output means failure.

| Grade | Complexity | Status |
|-------|-----------|--------|
| A | 1–5 | Pass |
| B | 6–10 | Pass |
| C | 11–15 | **Fail** |
| D+ | 16+ | **Fail** |

**To fix:** extract helper functions to reduce branching. Common strategies:
- Replace chained `if/elif` with a dispatch dict or loop
- Extract nested logic into a dedicated helper
- Use data-driven patterns (tuples/lists of descriptors) instead of repeated conditional blocks

## 4. Copy-Paste Detection (`make cpd`)

```
uvx --from pylint symilar -d 15 --ignore-imports --ignore-docstrings --ignore-signatures $(find src -name "*.py")
```

Uses [symilar](https://pylint.readthedocs.io/en/latest/symilar.html) (part of pylint) to detect duplicated code blocks. Any block of 15 or more similar lines in `src/` is flagged.

- **Scope**: `src/` only — tests are excluded because test files are intentionally repetitive by design
- **Threshold**: 15 minimum duplicate lines (`-d 15`)
- **Ignored**: imports, docstrings, and signatures (these are often legitimately similar)

**To fix:** extract the shared logic into a common module and import from both call sites. Typical locations for shared code:

- `src/lws/providers/_shared/` — utilities shared across providers
- A helper module alongside the duplicating files (e.g. `result_parser.py`)

## 5. Test Suite (`make test`)

```
uv run pytest --ignore=tests/e2e
```

Runs all unit, integration, and architecture tests. E2E tests are excluded because they require a running `ldk dev` instance. All tests must pass.

## Quick Reference

| Command | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `make check` | Run all checks (what CI runs) |
| `make lint` | Lint only |
| `make format` | Auto-format code |
| `make format-check` | Check formatting without changes |
| `make complexity` | Check complexity (grade B or better) |
| `make cpd` | Check for duplicated code (15+ lines) |
| `make test` | Run test suite (excludes e2e) |
| `make test-e2e` | Run e2e tests (requires running `ldk dev`) |
| `uvx ruff check --fix src tests` | Auto-fix lint issues |

## Before Submitting a PR

Run `make check` and fix any failures. Most formatting and import issues can be auto-fixed:

```bash
uvx ruff check --fix src tests  # fix lint issues
make format                      # fix formatting
make check                       # verify everything passes
```

"""Session-scoped fixtures: start ldk dev, tear down via ldk stop."""

from __future__ import annotations

import subprocess
import time

import httpx
import pytest

E2E_PORT = 19300


@pytest.fixture(scope="session")
def e2e_port():
    return E2E_PORT


@pytest.fixture(scope="session", autouse=True)
def ldk_server(tmp_path_factory, e2e_port):
    """Start ldk dev as a subprocess, wait for readiness, yield, stop."""
    project_dir = tmp_path_factory.mktemp("e2e_project")
    proc = subprocess.Popen(
        [
            "uv",
            "run",
            "ldk",
            "dev",
            "--mode",
            "terraform",
            "--port",
            str(e2e_port),
            "--project-dir",
            str(project_dir),
            "--no-persist",
        ],
        stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
        stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
    )

    # Poll /_ldk/status until running=true (timeout after 30s)
    deadline = time.monotonic() + 30
    while time.monotonic() < deadline:
        try:
            resp = httpx.get(f"http://localhost:{e2e_port}/_ldk/status", timeout=2.0)
            if resp.status_code == 200 and resp.json().get("running"):
                break
        except (httpx.ConnectError, httpx.ConnectTimeout):
            pass
        time.sleep(0.5)
    else:
        proc.kill()
        raise RuntimeError("ldk dev failed to start within 30 seconds")

    yield e2e_port

    # Teardown via ldk stop
    subprocess.run(
        ["uv", "run", "ldk", "stop", "--port", str(e2e_port)],
        timeout=10,
    )
    proc.wait(timeout=10)


@pytest.fixture(scope="session")
def lws_invoke(e2e_port):
    """Return a helper that invokes lws CLI commands. Use in arrange phases."""
    from typer.testing import CliRunner

    from lws.cli.lws import app

    _runner = CliRunner()

    def _invoke(args: list[str]) -> str:
        result = _runner.invoke(app, args)
        if result.exit_code != 0:
            cmd = " ".join(args)
            raise RuntimeError(f"Arrange failed (lws {cmd}): {result.output}")
        return result.output

    return _invoke


@pytest.fixture(scope="session")
def assert_invoke(e2e_port):
    """Return a helper that invokes lws CLI commands. Use in assert phases."""
    from typer.testing import CliRunner

    from lws.cli.lws import app

    _runner = CliRunner()

    def _invoke(args: list[str]) -> str:
        result = _runner.invoke(app, args)
        if result.exit_code != 0:
            cmd = " ".join(args)
            raise AssertionError(f"Assert failed (lws {cmd}): {result.output}")
        return result.output

    return _invoke

[project]
name = "local-web-services"
version = "0.5.0"
description = "Run AWS CDK applications locally - accelerate development with agentic code editors"
readme = "README.md"
license = "MIT"
requires-python = ">=3.11"
keywords = ["aws", "cdk", "local", "development", "lambda", "dynamodb", "sqs", "sns", "s3", "ssm", "secretsmanager", "agentic", "ai", "code-editor", "vibe-coding"]
classifiers = [
    "Development Status :: 4 - Beta",
    "Intended Audience :: Developers",
    "License :: OSI Approved :: MIT License",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.11",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.12",
    "Programming Language :: Python :: 3.13",
    "Topic :: Software Development :: Testing",
    "Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries",
]
dependencies = [
    "fastapi>=0.110.0",
    "uvicorn[standard]>=0.27.0",
    "typer>=0.9.0",
    "watchdog>=4.0.0",
    "aiosqlite>=0.20.0",
    "croniter>=2.0.0",

]

[project.urls]

[project.scripts]
ldk = "lws.cli.ldk:app"
lws = "lws.cli.lws:app"

[build-system]
requires = ["hatchling"]
build-backend = "hatchling.build"

]

.DEFAULT_GOAL := help

.PHONY: help install lint format format-check complexity cpd test test-e2e check

help: ## Show available targets
	@grep -E '^[a-zA-Z_-]+:.*?## .*$$' $(MAKEFILE_LIST) | awk 'BEGIN {FS = ":.*?## "}; {printf "  %-15s %s\n", $$1, $$2}'

install: ## Install dependencies
	uv sync

lint: ## Run linter
	uvx ruff check src tests

format: ## Auto-format code
	uvx black src tests

format-check: ## Check formatting without changing files
	uvx black --check src tests

complexity: ## Check cyclomatic complexity (all functions must be grade B or better)
	uvx radon cc src -a -nc

cpd: ## Check for copy-pasted code (15+ similar lines)
	@output=$$(uvx --from pylint symilar -d 15 --ignore-imports --ignore-docstrings --ignore-signatures $$(find src -name "*.py")); \
	echo "$$output" | tail -1; \
	echo "$$output" | tail -1 | grep -q "duplicates=0 " || { echo "$$output"; exit 1; }

test: ## Run test suite (excludes e2e)
	uv run pytest --ignore=tests/e2e

test-e2e: ## Run e2e tests (no Docker required)
	uv run pytest tests/e2e/ -v

check: lint format-check complexity cpd test ## Run all checks (what CI runs)
